Package dev.thriving.oss.kafka.streams.cassandra.state.store

Interface CassandraStateStore

All Superinterfaces:
org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.StateStore
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractCassandraStore, CassandraKeyValueStore, CassandraVersionedKeyValueStore
public interface CassandraStateStore extends org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.StateStore
Implemented by all the libraries custom StateStore solutions. Further, provides helper methods to get ReadOnly stores for interactive queries.

      static final Function<String,String> DEFAULT_TABLE_NAME_FN

  • Method Details

    • readOnlyPartitionedKeyValueStore

      static <K, V> org.apache.kafka.streams.state.ReadOnlyKeyValueStore<K,V> readOnlyPartitionedKeyValueStore(org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams streams, String name, com.datastax.oss.driver.api.core.CqlSession session, String keyspace, boolean isCountAllEnabled, String dmlExecutionProfile, org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.Serde<K> keySerde, org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.Serde<V> valueSerde)
      Get an optimised special implementation of ReadOnlyKeyValueStore for 'partitioned' type CassandraKeyValueStore. The returned object can be used to query the state directly from the underlying Cassandra table. No 'RPC layer' is required since queries for all/individual partitions are executed from this instance, and query results are merged where necessary.
      The instance has to be created when the streams app is in RUNNING state and can then be re-used!
      Note: for global CassandraKeyValueStore, use readOnlyGlobalKeyValueStore(org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams, java.lang.String)!
      Type Parameters:
      K - key data type
      V - value data type
      Parameters:
      streams - the kafka streams instance
      name - the name of the state store
      session - cassandra session to be used by the store (cannot be null)
      keyspace - state store specific keyspace, when null is passed, the CqlSession default applies
      isCountAllEnabled - enable `SELECT COUNT(*)` to be used. . SELECT COUNT(*) requires significant CPU and I/O resources and may be quite slow depending on store size... use with care!!!
      dmlExecutionProfile - the driver execution profile to use for DML queries
      keySerde - the key Serde to use (cannot be null)
      valueSerde - the value Serde to use (cannot be null)
      Returns:
      an instance of CassandraPartitionedReadOnlyKeyValueStore
      Throws:
      org.apache.kafka.streams.errors.StreamsNotStartedException - If Streams has not yet been started. Just call KafkaStreams.start() and then retry this call.

    • readOnlyPartitionedKeyValueStore

      static <K, V> org.apache.kafka.streams.state.ReadOnlyKeyValueStore<K,V> readOnlyPartitionedKeyValueStore(org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams streams, String name, com.datastax.oss.driver.api.core.CqlSession session, String keyspace, boolean isCountAllEnabled, String dmlExecutionProfile, org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.Serde<K> keySerde, org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.Serde<V> valueSerde, Function<String,String> tableNameFn, org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.StreamPartitioner<K,V> partitioner)
      Get an optimised special implementation of ReadOnlyKeyValueStore for 'partitioned' type CassandraKeyValueStore. The returned object can be used to query the state directly from the underlying Cassandra table. No 'RPC layer' is required since queries for all/individual partitions are executed from this instance, and query results are merged where necessary.
      The instance has to be created when the streams app is in RUNNING state and can then be re-used!
      Note: for global CassandraKeyValueStore, use readOnlyGlobalKeyValueStore(org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams, java.lang.String)!
      Type Parameters:
      K - key data type
      V - value data type
      Parameters:
      streams - the kafka streams instance
      name - the name of the state store
      session - cassandra session to be used by the store (cannot be null)
      keyspace - state store specific keyspace, when null is passed, the CqlSession default applies
      isCountAllEnabled - enable `SELECT COUNT(*)` to be used. . SELECT COUNT(*) requires significant CPU and I/O resources and may be quite slow depending on store size... use with care!!!
      dmlExecutionProfile - the driver execution profile to use for DML queries
      keySerde - the key Serde to use (cannot be null)
      valueSerde - the value Serde to use (cannot be null)
      tableNameFn - function to transform 'kstreams store name' -> 'cql table name'. If null, DEFAULT_TABLE_NAME_FN is used.
      partitioner - The partitioner to determine the partition for a key. If null, DefaultStreamPartitioner is used.
      Returns:
      an instance of CassandraPartitionedReadOnlyKeyValueStore
      Throws:
      org.apache.kafka.streams.errors.StreamsNotStartedException - If Streams has not yet been started. Just call KafkaStreams.start() and then retry this call.

    • readOnlyGlobalKeyValueStore

      static <K, V> org.apache.kafka.streams.state.ReadOnlyKeyValueStore<K,V> readOnlyGlobalKeyValueStore(org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams streams, String storeName)
      Get a facade wrapping the local CassandraStateStore. The returned object can be used to query the 'global' CassandraStateStore instances. Since the 'globalKeyValueStore' variant is not partitioned, specific StoreQueryParameters are specified to ensure correct results and avoid unnecessary queries to the Cassandra database.
      Type Parameters:
      K - the key type
      V - the value type
      Parameters:
      streams - the kafka streams instance
      storeName - the name of the state store
      Returns:
      a facade wrapping the local CassandraStateStore instances
      Throws:
      org.apache.kafka.streams.errors.StreamsNotStartedException - If Streams has not yet been started. Just call KafkaStreams.start() and then retry this call.
      org.apache.kafka.streams.errors.UnknownStateStoreException - If the specified store name does not exist in the topology.
      org.apache.kafka.streams.errors.InvalidStateStorePartitionException - If the specified partition does not exist.
      org.apache.kafka.streams.errors.InvalidStateStoreException - If the Streams instance isn't in a queryable state. If the store's type does not match the QueryableStoreType, the Streams instance is not in a queryable state with respect to the parameters, or if the store is not available locally, then an InvalidStateStoreException is thrown upon store access.
